div.p: The most significant turning point is a crossroads I came to when two opportunities came at the exact same time, the exact same day
Mainstream Radio or Fire Fighter post and my heart was leading to the DJ-ing because it’s something I always wanted to do
and the Mainstream Radio that came through was as a kid is the one that I always wanted to go for; I didn’t really see the importance of
the Fire Fighter post at the time, I always thought the Fire Fighter post I could always go back for whenever I wanted to
I mean I was only like 23 or 24 at the time so that was my understanding was “oh yeah, I can try that next year” but the Mainstream Radio
you can’t try again can you? Once if comes if that goes you know you’re out and I was nearly going to go for it but
you know I sort of talked around, I wouldn't even say talked around where it was like I just listened to everybody else, you know
my missis who is my wife now, she was my girlfriend at the time, said to me “what do you always think about money-wise?”
and money-wise I still think of now is how I’m going to have that, I always want a good amount of money coming in month by month
being able to have a pension, would the DJ-ing give me that? No. Would it give me the most enjoyment? Yes. But I'm always
worrying about where the next money’s coming from but the Fire Fighter would, you know, allow me to know where I'm getting
that money from so I went with that and it’s the best decision ever since really because of the experiences I’ve had with it.
